summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Magic Auto Sale LLC on September 6, 2019, by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It commands the company to produce documents related to specific vehicle transactions and individuals as part of a criminal investigation into alleged violations of federal law. The document includes a rider specifying requested records and a non-disclosure request to preserve investigation confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Signed the subpoena and is the point of contact for compliance and non-disclosure matters.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Magic Auto Sale LLC is commanded to appear before the grand jury at the United States Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and produce documents.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is issued to Magic Auto Sale LLC, initiating document production for a criminal investigation.

locations: Magic Auto Sale LLC, 407-409 US Highway 46 East, Little Ferry, NJ 07643
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
The Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a federal grand jury investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1791 and 201.

Magic Auto Sale LLC is ordered to produce documents related to a specific temporary tag number and an individual identified only by date of birth (DOB), with records requested from January 1, 2019, onward.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requests that Magic Auto Sale LLC voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.
The subpoena demands a wide range of documents, including purchase history, vehicle information, financial records, and correspondence, from both business and personal devices used by employees.
Failure to comply with the subpoena may result in contempt of court, civil sanctions, and criminal penalties.
